post_text:
Good afternoon Northwood Elementary Families!

As we enter this next phase to finish up the school year, we would like to provide guidance on the end of the school year procedures.

Starting May 4th there will be an instructional shift. The Week of May 4th through the 8th and May 11th-12th will be a time for students to complete or catch up on past assignments. Students will participate in online enrichment activities as well as continue utilizing apps such as RAZkids, Dreambox, and other apps teachers have shared.

On May 13th, 14th and15th, we will have mandatory iPad and charger collection at Northwood. Students will also be able to collect their personal belongings (including medication)…
text:
Good afternoon Northwood Elementary Families!

As we enter this next phase to finish up the school year, we would like to provide guidance on the end of the school year procedures.

Starting May 4th there will be an instructional shift. The Week of May 4th through the 8th and May 11th-12th will be a time for students to complete or catch up on past assignments. Students will participate in online enrichment activities as well as continue utilizing apps such as RAZkids, Dreambox, and other apps teachers have shared.

On May 13th, 14th and15th, we will have mandatory iPad and charger collection at Northwood. Students will also be able to collect their personal belongings (including medication)…

post_text:
You’re invited to the 2019-2020 Northwood Safety Town Experience

Who? Northwood Students and Families
(all students must be accompanied by an adult)

When? August 29th, 2019 5-7PM

Where? Northwood Elementary School

How much?: ABSOLUTELY FREE

What can we do? Bring your bike and test your bike skills in our obstacle course; meet and greet the district SROs, emergency personnel, and Mike Stevens, Mayor of Clayton; explore various emergency vehicles; receive important information on arrival and dismissal procedures for the school, PRIZES and more!!
text:
You’re invited to the 2019-2020 Northwood Safety Town Experience

Who? Northwood Students and Families
(all students must be accompanied by an adult)

When? August 29th, 2019 5-7PM

Where? Northwood Elementary School

How much?: ABSOLUTELY FREE

What can we do? Bring your bike and test your bike skills in our obstacle course; meet and greet the district SROs, emergency personnel, and Mike Stevens, Mayor of Clayton; explore various emergency vehicles; receive important information on arrival and dismissal procedures for the school, PRIZES and more!!

post_text:
PARENT ORIENTATION NIGHTS:

This an evening where teachers can explain grade level expectations, curriculum, and policies. This night is truly intended for parents only. We do understand if you have to bring your child; however, when children are present it does tend to get noisy and distracting. Additionally, we will start on time @ 6:00PM.

6th Grade- Monday, August 26

4th Grade- Tuesday, August 27

3rd Grade- Wednesday, August 28

5th Grade- Wednesday, September 4

2nd Grade- Thursday, September 5

shared_text:
Northmont City Schools
July 13, 2019 at 8:17 AM ·

YMCA Before and After Care Program

Northmont has partnered with YMCA to expand the high quality before and after school program to all five elementary schools for the 2019-2020 school year, that has been running very successfully at the Kleptz Early Learning Center. Open houses will be held at each elementary during the week of July 23-25. Check our website for updates throughout this summer, and see current information listed below:

ENROLLMENT PACKETS for the 2019-2020 School Year are now available at the Front Desk of the Kleptz YMCA, and at the Northmont District office at 4001 Old Salem Rd.

The packet MUST be completed in full and returned before your child is considered…

post_text:
Tips for a cold, snowy day off:
Wash coats, hats, scarves, & gloves to ward off the spread of germs.
Wipe down backpacks and school supplies with Lysol/Clorox wipes.
Remind children of the importance of hand-washing.
Get lots of rest and stay healthy.
See you all tomorrow!

6th grade students: Register today!

Last Call for Summer Campers!

We still have room at our summer day-camp for incoming sixth grade students!

Where? At Northmont High School

When? Monday, July 16th / 8:30 AM– 2:30 AM Thursday, July 19th
Registration Deadline: Monday, July 9, 2018.

Cost: $25.00

· Leaderquest 3.0 Summer Day-Camp is a time when students learn extremely important life skills in developing friendships, learning leadership skills and new ways of making a difference in their homes, their school and the communities.

· LeaderQuest 3.0 combines the best of traditional summer camp experiences – amazing friendships and a powerhouse team of extraordinary teen and adult…

post_text: "Family Movie Night" at Northwood is Thursday night, from 6pm-8pm. PTO opted for a school night so that people affected by weekend activities would also be able to attend. Students voted for "The Emoji Movie". There is no charge to attend, popcorn will be provided at no cost, and cans of soda will be available for 50 cents. Please feel free to pick up a convenient dinner to eat during the movie, as well. We are looking forward to enjoying the movie, together, with you! 😊
text: "Family Movie Night" at Northwood is Thursday night, from 6pm-8pm. PTO opted for a school night so that people affected by weekend activities would also be able to attend. Students voted for "The Emoji Movie". There is no charge to attend, popcorn will be provided at no cost, and cans of soda will be available for 50 cents. Please feel free to pick up a convenient dinner to eat during the movie, as well. We are looking forward to enjoying the movie, together, with you! 😊
